overview: The United Arab Emirates has established a progressive regulatory framework for tokenization, with Dubai's Virtual Assets Regulatory Authority (VARA) leading the way. Dubai has created a comprehensive regulatory regime for virtual assets including tokens, while the federal UAE government has also issued regulations through the Securities and Commodities Authority (SCA).

regulations.title: Dubai Virtual Assets Regulation Law (Law No. 4 of 2022)
regulations.description: Establishes VARA as the regulatory authority for virtual assets in Dubai and provides the framework for licensing and regulation

regulations.title: VARA Virtual Assets and Related Activities Regulations 2023
regulations.description: Comprehensive regulations covering licensing, conduct, compliance, and operational requirements for virtual asset service providers

regulations.title: VARA Marketing Regulations 2023
regulations.description: Governs marketing and promotion of virtual assets and related services in Dubai

regulations.title: Federal Decree-Law No. 47 of 2022
regulations.description: Federal law regulating virtual assets at the UAE national level through the Securities and Commodities Authority

regulations.title: VARA Token Services Regulations
regulations.description: Specific regulations for token issuance, custody, and trading services

requirements: VARA license required for operating virtual asset activities in Dubai
Minimum capital requirements varying by license type
Cybersecurity and data protection measures required
Token issuers must provide detailed disclosure documents
Custody of virtual assets must meet VARA standards
Market abuse and insider trading prohibitions enforced
Consumer protection and fair treatment obligations
authorities: Securities and Commodities Authority (SCA) - Federal UAE
Dubai Financial Services Authority (DFSA) - Dubai International Financial Centre
